com.intel.jndn.utils

Class SegmentedClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.jndn.utils.SegmentedClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client

    public class SegmentedClient
extends Object
implements Client
    Provide a client to simplify retrieving segmented Data packets over the NDN network. This class expects the Data producer to follow the NDN naming conventions (see http://named-data.net/doc/tech-memos/naming-conventions.pdf) and produce Data packets with a valid segment as the last component of their name; additionally, at least the first packet should set the FinalBlockId of the packet's MetaInfo (see http://named-data.net/doc/ndn-tlv/data.html#finalblockid).
    Author:
    Andrew Brown

      • getDefault

        public static SegmentedClient getDefault()
        Singleton access for simpler client use.
        Returns:

      • getAsync

        public Future<net.named_data.jndn.Data> getAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                                        net.named_data.jndn.Interest interest)
        Asynchronously send Interest packets for a segmented result; will not block, but will wait for the first packet to return before sending remaining interests until using the specified FinalBlockId. Will retrieve non-segmented packets as well.
        Specified by:
        getAsync in interface Client
        Parameters:
        face - the Face on which to retrieve the packets
        interest - should include either a ChildSelector or an initial segment number; the initial segment number will be cut off in the de-segmented packet.
        Returns:
        a list of FutureData packets; if the first segment fails, the list will contain one FutureData with the failure exception

      • getAsync

        public Future<net.named_data.jndn.Data> getAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                                        net.named_data.jndn.Name name)
        Asynchronously send Interest packets for a segmented result; see getAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face, net.named_data.jndn.Interest) for more information.
        Parameters:
        face - the Face on which to retrieve the packets
        name - the Name of the packet to retrieve using a default interest; may optionally end with the segment component of the first segment to retrieve
        Returns:
        an aggregated data packet from all received segments

      • getSync

        public net.named_data.jndn.Data getSync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                               net.named_data.jndn.Interest interest)
                                 throws IOException
        Retrieve a segmented Data packet; see getAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face, net.named_data.jndn.Interest) for more information. This method will block and call Face.processEvents() until the sent interests timeout or the corresponding data packets are retrieved.
        Specified by:
        getSync in interface Client
        Parameters:
        face -
        interest - should include either a ChildSelector or an initial segment number
        Returns:
        a Data packet; the name will inherit from the sent Interest, not the returned packets and the content will be a concatenation of all of the packet contents.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getSync

        public net.named_data.jndn.Data getSync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                               net.named_data.jndn.Name name)
                                 throws IOException
        Synchronously retrieve the Data for a Name using a default interest (e.g. 2 second timeout). This method will block and call Face.processEvents() until the sent interests timeout or the corresponding data packets are retrieved.
        Parameters:
        face -
        name -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • hasSegment

        public static boolean hasSegment(net.named_data.jndn.Name name)
        Check if a name ends in a segment component; uses marker value found in the NDN naming conventions (see http://named-data.net/doc/tech-memos/naming-conventions.pdf).

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new instance of Name with no segment component appended
